name: Candied Pecans
description: This recipe for candied pecans only requires a few ingredients and makes the most deliciously sweet, cinnamon-flavored, crunchy nuts for snacking.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350ºF. Add the brown sugar, granulated sugar, cinnamon, and salt to a bowl, then stir them together until evenly combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350ºF. Add the brown sugar, granulated sugar, cinnamon, and salt to a bowl, then stir them together until evenly combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Separate the egg and place the egg white in a large bowl. Lightly whisk the egg white until it is frothy, then add the vanilla extract and briefly whisk again to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Separate the egg and place the egg white in a large bowl. Lightly whisk the egg white until it is frothy, then add the vanilla extract and briefly whisk again to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the pecans to the egg white mixture and stir to coat. Sprinkle the cinnamon sugar mixture over the nuts and stir to coat again.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the pecans to the egg white mixture and stir to coat. Sprinkle the cinnamon sugar mixture over the nuts and stir to coat again.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread the coated nuts out onto a large baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread the coated nuts out onto a large baking sheet lined with parchment paper.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake the nuts in the preheated 350ºF for 25 minutes, stirring once halfway through.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake the nuts in the preheated 350ºF for 25 minutes, stirring once halfway through.

recipeInstructions.text: Allow the nuts to cool completely before enjoying or storing for later.
recipeInstructions.name: Allow the nuts to cool completely before enjoying or storing for later.

review.reviewBody: These are perfection! I used four cups of pecan halfs to estimate one pound.
These are really tasty, and easy to make! even stirring halfway through baking time was a piece of cake! I think I will try almonds next… :)

Absolute wonderful. We made them as a gift, but may keep them and make something for the gift.
Merry Christmas
